title: Job Openings at Ardova Plc Ardova Plc
content:
Ardova Plc is a Nigerian leading indigenous and integrated energy company involved in the distribution of petroleum products. With an extensive network of over 450 retail outlets in Nigeria and significant storage facilities in Apapa, Lagos and Onne, Rivers State, we procure and distribute petrol (PMS), diesel (AGO), kerosene (DPK) and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG). Our services also involve the manufacturing and distribution of a wide range of quality lubricants from our oil blending plant in Apapa, Lagos. These lubricants include: Super V, Visco 2000 and Diesel Motor Oil. We are also the sole authorised distributor of Shell branded Helix Engine Oils in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

            
    



1.) Business Manager (Retail), Southwest & North II

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Optimization of company’s assets for sales and marketing of all company‘s products across the retail outlets and providing leadership to the Retail Marketing Associates within the region to deliver set targets.
	The job holder is charged with coordinating sales activities, development and implementation of strategies and plans to achieve expected levels of sales at the retail outlets across designated region.


Job Details


	Business development of the company operated outlets in the region.
	Lead the drive for the growth of AP’s market share in the region 
	Ensure compliance is maintained with AP’s policies in operation area.
	Deliver on volume, revenue, profit and OPEX set targets 
	Provide leadership to the team to foster collaboration needed to function as a unit.
	Drive regulatory compliance within area of operation.
	Set budgets and conduct periodic performance appraisal for Retail Marketing Associates 
	Ensure compliance with HSE standards across all retail outlets in the region
	Liaise with Terminal operations and fleet to ensure product availability and optimal stock quantities for the stations
	Propose product prices to drive profitability and revenue.     
	Keep abreast of industry and market trends, as well as competition at the regional level to support strategic decision making
	Drive the deployment of effective strategies to increase footfall at the retail outlets and strengthen the brand.


Requirements
Education:


	A Bachelor's Degree with a minimum of a 2.2 in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.


Experience:


	7-10 years of relevant experience


Skills:


	Able to present and express information effectively and also responds positively to feedback
	Good knowledge of Ardova’s products and services
	Good customer service, relationship management tools, networking/teaming skills
	Good understanding of the local and international Oil & Gas sector including guiding principles and regulations. Good knowledge of marketing operations in the downstream oil and gas marketing sector.
	Thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.
	Applies innovative solutions to problems and improve internal processes. 
	Good people management skills, supervisory, coaching and mentoring skills.


Benefits
Financial Benefits:


	Competitive Compensation: Receive a generous salary for your work
	Transport Stipend/ Fueling Allowance: Additional financial support for your daily commute 
	13th Month Allowances: Receive an extra boost at the end of the year
	Leave Allowances: Financial support to maintain a healthy work-life balance


Non-Financial Benefits:


	Comprehensive HMO Coverage: For employee, spouse, and up to four children
	Paid Time Off: Generous annual, parental, study, compassionate, and exam leave.
	Complimentary Lunch: Stay fueled and energized during work hours.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Retail Marketing Associate

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Retail Marketing Associate (RMA) is responsible for sales & marketing of all AP product offerings (white products, Lubricants, LPG, Renewables etc) at AP retail outlets.
	The job holder is responsible for retail outlets‘ supervision, business development, account reconcilliation, personnel training and development, conducting competitive analysis and stakeholder management at assigned territories.


Job Details


	Monthly appraisal of all Outlet Managers and Dealers within assigned area of coverage
	Expand the company’s retail footprint within assigned area of coverage
	Responsible for all Company outlets’ supervision within assigned area of coverage.
	Conduct financial exposure audit at Company Operated stations twice a month.
	Monthly account reconciliation and Dealer statement sign-off.
	Manage relationships with external stakeholders/regulatory authorities
	Manage retail customer under coverage and achieve set KPI’s
	Minimum of 2 station visits per month to each outlet under assigned area of coverage
	Deploy Retail Quality Checklist (RQC) at least once a month 
	Carry out random pump integrity checks at each retail outlet at least twice a month
	Carry out dumping and diversion spot checks monthly at retail stations
	Achieve zero outstanding proof of delivery waybills at the end of each sales month.
	Achieve 100% of volume and gross margin targets across all product lines monthly.


Requirements
Education:


	A Bachelor's Degree with a minimum of a 2.2 in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.


Experience:


	4-6 years of relevant experience


Skills:


	Able to present and express information effectively and also responds positively to feedback
	Good knowledge of Ardova’s products and services
	Good customer service, relationship management tools, networking/teaming skills
	Good understanding of the local and international Oil & Gas sector including guiding principles and regulations. Good knowledge of marketing operations in the downstream oil and gas marketing sector.
	Thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.
	Applies innovative solutions to problems and improve internal processes. 
	Good people management skills, supervisory, coaching and mentoring skills.

Solutions Architect Job at Paystack




        
    

        
        Paystack is a technology company solving payments problems for ambitious businesses. Paystack's mission is to help merchants in Africa get paid by anyone, anywhere in the world. Over 9,000 of some of the best businesses in Nigeria use Paystack’s modern payments gateway, including MTN, Taxify, Domino’s Pizza, Smile Communications, Opera, God is Good Motors, Axa Mansard Insurance, and many others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Solutions Architect

Job Location: Nigeria

About the Role
     

            
    




	The Technical Solutions team strives to be the best technical payment partner for global brands, enterprise businesses and startups operating in Africa.
	To achieve this, we partner with our merchants to unlock their full potential with Paystack by designing tailored solutions using our products to meet their unique needs and guiding them in adopting best practices that drive customer success and revenue growth.
	Our team works closely with the in-country business development teams to accelerate the sales cycle, and business onboarding.
	Additionally, we serve as a trusted bridge between our largest businesses and the product and engineering teams, sharing valuable feedback that shapes our products to solve real business challenges.


What You’ll Do
Pre-Sales Strategy and Solution Design:


	Work closely with the sales team to craft compelling Paystack solution proposals and pitches for potential clients.
	Lead technical discovery calls, asking the right questions to understand the prospect’s technical setup, payment challenges, and how they plan to use Paystack.
	Demonstrate Paystack’s product capabilities through live demos, API clients, sample projects, and other tools to help prospects visualize seamless integration.


Merchant Integration and Onboarding:


	Collaborate with newly signed merchants and the sales team to design tailored payment solutions.
	Prepare clear, structured Scope of Work documents to guide merchants through implementation.
	Ensure a smooth API onboarding experience by troubleshooting issues and optimizing integrations for scalability.


Post-Launch Growth and Optimization:


	Regularly review merchant performance, providing recommendations to optimize payments and unlock growth opportunities.
	Act as a trusted technical advisor, addressing escalations and maintaining strong client relationships.
	Identify upsell opportunities by recommending additional Paystack products and services.
	Gather feedback to improve Paystack’s product offerings and ensure long-term client success.


Industry and Market Expertise:


	Own the technical sales strategy for a specific industry or region.
	Develop and maintain an Industry Strategy Playbook, outlining how Paystack’s solutions address market-specific needs and challenges.


You'll thrive as a Solutions Architect if you:


	are based in Nigeria and have a background in software engineering, along with experience in technical sales and solutions design.
	have a proven track record of successfully working with enterprise-grade businesses in a technical, consultative role—understanding business needs, designing effective technical solutions, and communicating clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences.
	bring deep technical expertise, strong interpersonal and leadership skills, and the ability to build trust with senior executives while driving customer success throughout the entire journey. You think strategically and creatively, proactively identifying challenges, taking ownership, and maintaining a positive approach when facing obstacles.
	are well-versed in Nigeria’s tech and payment landscape and actively engaged in local developer communities. Public speaking ability is a welcome bonus.


Minimum Requirements


	Technical Experience: 5+ years in a technical role, ideally in pre-sales, customer support, or software engineering, with hands-on experience in REST APIs, SDKs, and payment gateway integrations.
	Solution Design & Integration: Proven experience in integrating technical solutions for external partners or merchants.
	Communication & Presentation: Ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
	Problem-Solving: A proactive, hands-on approach to troubleshooting and resolving technical challenges in real time, with a track record of methodically tackling issues to final resolution.
	Customer Success Mindset: Strong commitment to ensuring merchants succeed by delivering effective solutions and outstanding support.
	Project & Portfolio Management: Ability to manage multiple projects and merchant accounts while effectively prioritizing tasks.
	Industry Knowledge: Understanding of Nigeria’s fintech ecosystem, payment regulations, and compliance standards.
	Entrepreneurial Mindset: Ability to take initiative, navigate ambiguity, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
